column4: System-Administration-Hardware drivers won't offer me a proprietary nvidia driver to be installed like https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia says, what should I do?
read this https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories/CommandLine
do you want to say I might need to add a third party repo for proprietary driver to become available?

universe and multiverse repos seem to be enabled by default in vanilla /etc/apt/sources.list, I have no idea what to add to that file. Searching for "repo" on wiki page about proprietary nvidia driver returns no matches
paste your /etc/apt/sources.list to paste.ubuntu.com
http://paste.ubuntu.com/779110/
lol remove line 1 to 3
I don't understand, but line 1-3 are commented
is your ubuntu cdrom is inside your laptop or computer?
this is a new computer, they put an ubuntu into it so it's not empty. computer has no cd drive at all
did that, ran apt-get update, do I need a restart again before trying system-administration-hardware drivers?
still nothing, hardware drivers window is empty
just lspci or you want it with those verbose arguments? video card is geforce gt 430 btw
read this http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1673715
sudo apt-get install nvidia-xconfig and then sudo nvidia-xconfig and you are good
first one tells me it can't find such a package to install
i just give you the answer
by "first one" I meant I did "sudo apt-get install nvidia-xconfig" and it said couldn't find package nvidia-xconfig
installed nvidia-settings
what filename to use when saving? /etc/X11/xorg.conf ?
i did not install the nvidia driver, sudo modprobe nvidia fails

I am confused. that hardware drivers window is supposed to tell me what driver to install, yet it remains empty. probably i can do it manually using apt-get install, but i don't know the package name for the driver for my video card
